name: Lohagad
description: Lohagad Fort, literally meaning iron fort, is a historical citadel perched atop a hillock at an elevation of 3400 feet. Situated in the Sahyadri range of Lonavala, it separates the Indrayani basin from the Pawna basin. The elaborate history of this fort associates it with the great Maratha ruler Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj.

timelineMumbai.title: Board A Express Train to Lonavala from Dadar
Board a train to Malavali Station From Lonavala
Take a share cab to Lohgadwadi Village(5.4km)

timelinePune.title: Board a train from Pune to Lonavala
Take a train to Malavali Station
Take a share cab to Lohgadwadi Village(5.4km)

roadMumbai.title: Take the Express highway going towards Pune

roadPune.title: Take the Express highway going towards Mumbai

faqSection.question: What are the Places to look around
faqSection.answer: Bhaje Caves, Shiv Temple, Vinchu Katta, Laxmi Kothi

faqSection.question: Is Camping Allowed
faqSection.answer: No,Since fort gets closed around 6 p.m

faqSection.question: Is Water/Food Available
faqSection.answer: Yes,Local restaurants are located near the entrance of the Fort.

faqSection.question: How much is the Entrance Fee
faqSection.answer: It's Free

name: Tikona
description: Tikona also known as Vitandgad) is the dominant hill fort in Maval in western India. It is located near Kamshet around 60 km from Pune. The village nearest to the fort is called Tikona-Peth. The 3500 ft high hill is pyramidal in shape and the name Tikona means triangular

timelineMumbai.title: Board A Express Train to Lonavala from Dadar
Board a train to Kamshet Station From Lonavala
Take a local cab/Bus To Tikona Peth
Start the Trek from Tikona Peth

timelinePune.title: Board a train from Pune to Lonavala
Take a local cab/Bus To Tikona Peth
Start the Trek from Tikona Peth

roadMumbai.title: Take the Lonavala / Karla exit (2nd Exit) and get on old NH4
Drive on the old Mumbai-Pune Highway towards Pune for 10km
Take a right at Kamshet towards Pavana Dam and drive for 14km.
Take a left at Pavana Dam to get onto Paud road and drive for 5 km.
Reach at Tikona peth and start trekking

roadPune.title: From Kamshet, take a left on to Pavana road and drive for 14km.
Take a left at Pavana Dam to get onto Paud road and drive for 5 km.
Reach at Tikona peth and start trekking

faqSection.question: What are the Places to look around
faqSection.answer: Pawana Lake(4.5km from fort), Rock cut water,caves, Hanuman Idol

faqSection.question: Is Camping Allowed
faqSection.answer: No, Since fort gets closed around 6 p.m

faqSection.question: Is Water/Food Available
faqSection.answer: Yes, Local restaurants are located near the entrance of the Fort.

faqSection.question: How much is the Entrance Fee
faqSection.answer: It's Free

name: Karnala
description: Karnala fort (also called Funnel Hill) is a hill fort in Raigad district about 10 km from Panvel city. Currently it is a protected place lying within the Karnala Bird Sanctuary. It was a fort of strategic importance as it overlooked the Bor pass which connected the Konkan coast to the interior of Maharashtra (Deccan Plateau)[1] and was the main trade route between these areas.

timelineMumbai.title: Board a Train till Panvel from cst/Kurla/Thane
Take a bus or shared cab/rickshaw to the base of the fort(10km from panvel station)

timelinePune.title: Board a train from Pune to Panvel Station(3 hours journey)
Take a bus or shared cab/rickshaw to the base of the fort(10km from panvel station)

roadMumbai.title: Follow Dadar TT Flyover, Dr Baba Saheb Ambedkar Rd and Dadar TT Flyover to Khareghat Rd in Parsee Colony
Get on Eastern Fwy in Bhakti Park from Lady Jehangir Rd, Barkat Ali Dargah Rd and Sewri - Chembur Rd

Continue on Eastern Fwy. Take Bengaluru - Mumbai Hwy/Mumbai Hwy/Mumbai - Pandharpur Rd/Mumbai - Pune Hwy/Sion - Panvel Expy/VN Purav Marg, Old Vashi Bridge and Bengaluru - Mumbai Hwy/Mumbai Hwy/Mumbai - Pandharpur Rd/Mumbai - Pune Hwy/Sion - Panvel Expy to NH 48 in Sector 1, Navi Mumbai. Exit from Bengaluru - Mumbai Hwy/Mumbai Hwy/Mumbai - Pandharpur Rd/Mumbai - Pune Hwy/Sion - Panvel Expy
Reach at Tikona peth and start trekking

roadPune.title: Get on Mumbai - Pune Highway in Kotwal Nagar, Pimpri-Chinchwad from MH SH 114, Ganeshkhind Rd, NDA Pashan Rd/Pashan Rd, Pashan - Sus Rd and NH 48.

name: Naneghat
description: Naneghat, also referred to as Nanaghat or Nana Ghat, is a mountain pass in the Western Ghats range between the Konkan coast and the ancient town of Junnar in the Deccan plateau. The pass is about 120 kilometres (75 mi) north of Pune and about 165 kilometres (103 mi) east from Mumbai, Maharashtra, India.It was a part of an ancient trading route, and is famous for a major cave with Hindu Sanskrit inscriptions in Brahmi script. The Naneghat Hills are a prime tourist attraction situated in the Malshej Ghat region of the Thane District. They are elevated at an altitude of 838.2 m above the sea level

timelineMumbai.title: Board a Local Train till Kalyan junction from Dadar
Reach Tokawade Village and walk about 5km till start point of Naneghat.

Continue on NH60 to Mahtre Wadi, Narayangaon
Follow Narayangaon - Junnar Rd and MH SH 111 to NH61

name: Rajgad fort
description: Rajgad (literal meaning Ruling Fort) is a hill fort situated in the Pune district of Maharashtra, India. Formerly known as Murumdev, the fort was the capital of the Maratha Empire under the rule of Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj for almost 26 years, after which the capital was moved to the Raigad Fort. Treasures discovered from an adjacent fort called Torna were used to completely build and fortify the Rajgad Fort

name: Kalsubai
description: Kalsubai is a mountain in the Western Ghats, located in the Indian state of Maharashtra. Its summit situated at an elevation of 1646 metres (5400 feet) is the highest point in Maharashtra

name: Korigad
description: Korigad is a hill fort located about 20 km south of Lonavla in Pune district, Maharashtra, India. Its date of construction is not known but likely predates 1500. It is about 923 m above sea level. The planned township of Aamby Valley is built over the fort's southern and eastern foothills.

name: Rajmachi
description: Rajmachi Fort is one of the many historical forts in the rugged hills of Sahyadri mountains. It consists of two twin fortresses Shriwardhan and Manaranjan, with a wide machi surrounding the two Balekillas.

name: Mahuli
description: Mahuli Fort Trek difficulty is medium, Endurance for this trek difficult. Water availability at the base village and a small perennial drinking water cistern on top you can Combine this Trek with following options Ajoba Hill, Sitecha Palna, pinnacles in Vorpadi. Best time to Trek Mahuli is from June to December. Food availability place an order with the local villager and return to enjoy the delicacy. Base Village Mahuli Village. Camping is now available near base village of Mahuli Fort
